reviews.review_msg: Onkar was a chill prof. The flipped lecture class where you watch lectures on your own time worked for me but i know it wasn't great for others so beware of that if you take a course with him. Overall he makes the content easier to learn however and gives you a decent amount of practice to understand concepts. Would recommend
You should prepare the course by yourself with the help of AI technologies. This lecturer is not helpful at all. Use your AI to read your textbook pdf. Don't read his incomprehensible notes.

Had Dr. Bains as both the Lecturer and Lab Instructor during the summer semester.  He uses a flipped classroom method of teaching which really helped in preparing for exams.  I enjoyed his sense of humour and cool gifs on the lecture slides.  Exams (including the lab) were very fair.

One of the best professors. He will do everything which will be in favour of the students.  1 midterm, 1 final, 1 lab exam (open book- you can score great if prepare for it correctly even if it is open book), 1 assignment. Definitely recommend Professor Onkar. 
Exam questions were more difficult than the practice questions.

Found the midterm to be a bit harder, but the final wasn't too bade. Exams are fair and all based on lecture material. Never went to class and he posted the material online so I was able to listen to the lectures at my own time. Most important thing for him is looking at lots of examples and understanding them, which will be seen on exams.

Dr.Bains is an awesome teacher who understands what it means to be a student. The exams were really fair and not that difficult, the labs were fun, and the lab exam was also extremely fair. Honestly, one of the best courses I've taken at SFU.
Onkar is a good prof who clearly has a passion for teaching. His exams were fair, and lectures were not mandatory as everything was recorded. Course material was pretty easy and fun to learn.

Onkar is a nice prof who cares about his students and makes his presentation slides funny with gifs and pictures; however he also reads completely off his slides which makes it very disengaging for me. Don't show up to lecture and u will be fine as long as u read the slides on ur own time
I LOVE this prof. Course material is heavy but he gives a lot of practice questions which helps you a lot. I would 100% recommend this prof.

Onkar was such an awesome prof! He really cared for his students and was always available to talk or answer questions. The midterms (we had two) were okay (both 50 min) but the final I found was super difficult. Also lectures you really do not need to go, but he was super funny in them!

Took this course a second time and I have to say Dr. B. was a WAY better teacher.  I like the format of listening to pre-recorded lectures (which had its own practice questions) and then meeting in person to work on more challenging questions (helped with the exams).  He has a passion for biology and is funny!  Love the gifs used on slides.

Love, love, love, love, love this prof!  Dr. Bains rekindled my passion for Biology.  Always answered questions I had (and even replied to emails on the weekend).  Had many practice questions during lectures which helped big time during exams.  I wish we had more profs like him!

Amazing prof! I loved how he uses real life examples and I felt super smart applying plant genetics when I went to a nursery. I talked about co-dominance of rhododendrons and environmental influence on hydrangeas with the employees. Overall, he has fair exams and is clear with clear notes.

I thoroughly enjoyed the lecture format with lots of practice questions.  Dr. Bains rekindled my love for biology!  Thank you for being a great lecturer and listener.  Always willing to help whenever there was something I did not understand.

Dr. B is one the more entertaining lecturers I have had. He goes the extra mile to help students with YouTube links, lecture recordings (for those unable to attend), learning objectives, practice questions, and office hours on Saturdays and Sundays.  Most questions were expected, but some involved applying what you learned rather than memorizing.

I really enjoyed BISC 102.  Dr. Bains is a very good Instructor and you can tell that he wants his students do their best.    Lots of practice exam questions.  The YouTube videos and student learning objectives made studying easier.  Also, Dr. Bains was very accommodating (he even had office hours on the weekend!!).

Best prof that I have had so far at SFU.  Plenty of practice questions in class and he does scale the grades if needed.  I liked that he added animations to his notes.  There are some concepts that require extra effort but he does break things down into simple steps.  I would definitely take another class with him.
Great professor! He made me enjoy biology even though it was tough at times. I would take his courses again!

One of my favourite courses so far.  Dr. Bains is just a breath of fresh air.  Love the practice question sessions, the laid back teaching style, and positive attitude!  The student learning objectives are helpful when studying along with the YouTube video links for each lecture topic.  The online lab worksheets coincided well with the lecture.
Amazing prof

Dr. Bains has been super helpful this term. I would rather have weekly lab worksheets than a lab final any day! I like the fact that we get one freebie when it comes to lab worksheets which won't count to the overall grade. He and the rest of the teaching team have done a good job with transitioning the course online.
WORST INSTUCTOR EVER!
Grade by few things, not clear criteria, ambiguous guideline.

This was my second class with Onkar and has made the course 10x more enjoyable. He's an amazing prof. He cares about his students and emphasizes on what to study through a set of learning objectives. 100% would take ANY class he teaches.

I love Dr. Bains!! he's honestly the best lab prof and his midterm's arent even hard if you do the SLO. Highly recommend. Got C in bisc 101 with another prof and got almost an A with onkar in bisc 102. Wish i had him for bisc 101 too

Dr. Bains is just the best teacher I have had so far. He is very patient, encourages students to do well, makes lectures easy to follow (although perhaps tone down on the number of fill in the blanks for some lectures), and asks fair questions on exam (especially when there are student learning objectives provided). Highly recommended!!!

Amazing professor who would kindly listen and respond to all your questions during office hours and labs alike. Although one must understand almost everything that is on the lecture notes to succeed, Onkar makes it easier to do so by creating an extremely clear and concise set of notes.

Professor Bains was awesome! It was my second class with him and I was extremely fortunate to be able to have another class with him! I would not hesitate to take a class with him! His student learning objectives are golden, his slides are clear and concise, and he is extremely caring about his students! 10/10 would take again! Onkar is amazing!!!

Fantastic professor. I was truly fortunate to have him for both bio I and bio II. Super straight forward in terms of what's on the exams, no surprises at all. Couldn't have believed it when he told us that this was his first time teaching BISC102 when his lecture notes and the way he explained concepts were exceptional already.

Superman of teaching!! Super helpful, super encouraging and a super sense of humor. The labs were a little on the tough side, but Onkar just made things simpler to understand. Thanks for being a super lab instructor! To be honest, I wish he was teaching the lecture too!

Enthusiastic and easy to understand. My lab partners and I agree that Dr. Bains is one of the best. We appreciate it when he mentions common mistakes made by students in exams from previous semesters so that we do not make the same errors. More than willing to help out but you do need to show that you are putting in the effort.

Had him as my BISC 102 lab instructor during the summer semester. The Mad Scrambles were very helpful in making sure that my friends and I kept up with studying for the lab exam during the semester. Very fair lab quizzes and exam.

Worst prof Ive had honestly, midterm was horrible, final was better but the marking is so ambiguous because theres so many possible answers for every question you dont even know what to aim for and the prof isnt going to help you out, would never take this class or prof again
You would be confused and lose mark by following her "guidance".
Not good if you usually deal with many unexpected situations.
Easiest mid term ever. Didn't really need to study as long as you attended lecture and did home work.

So enthusiastic and animated that it's cute.  Always happy to help and in general, a very nice prof who isn't trying to fail you all.  However, she never finishes her lectures so she ended up lecturing about last week's readings.  Otherwise, she's fab and fair.
One of the most kind and wonderful personalities for a prof - taking her class is just amazing

Although a lot of people here seem to think Tunbridge is great I strongly disagree. She wasn't really capable of answering a lot of basic questions and would simply answer 'I don't know.' Some of her midterm and exam questions were misleading and actually quite ridiculous. Her level of incompetence is a huge part of the reason i changed majors.

Ok, there were A LOT of materials to study. Exams seem easy but she wants high expectations on the answers so difficult overall. I spent so much time preparing for studying for this course and I think I put my effort like A+ level but I got a B- at the end of the term. This is what this course is like. Good luck people...
Midterm was really difficult for a 100 level course. Lab exam was pretty hard and the fact that you need to pass the lab exam to pass the entire course is pretty ridiculous. Overall decent prof.

covers alot of material, class lecture is confusing at times, midterm is easy, lab final is studied hard is easy..FINAL IS VERY HARD SO STUDY UR BRAINS OUT b/c the writtern part you have to be clear in explanation (IF SAME AS BOOK THEN GOOD). also tutorial was a waste of time...ps payattention to guest lecturers

She is the best Bisc prof ever! She is quite the looker too! She like handled everything: lab, lecture etc..yeah it is too bad she is leaving :( Though, the final was harder than expected. Like every other course, study on a regular basis and you'll pass.
Very helpful. Lab exam was pretty simple. Study notes very well for the final!

this course covers toooo much material, that she should have trimmed it down but she didnt. the first midterm was way too long, and very difficult. Lab exam was not bad, but difficulty was random since there were 20 stations, u were given a number n u only need to do 4. final was pretty hard, even the short answers part require critical thinking.
Excellent speaker, shes also lab instructor so there is no confusion between lecture and lab materials. plus shes hot as hell!

She's a nice teacher who's lectures are not that bad. Ecology was kind of boring though. Textbook readings were recommended but only served to back up lecture material. Just go to lectures, listen, and understand. She has her own grading scale so it's easy to do well as long as you keep on top and don't fall behind. BISC lab was pointless though.

Great professor. very interesting and funny. awesome videos. Mid term wasn't too bad. Just be prepared to use your knowledge rather than cramming. Don't waste too much time on Inquiry Figure assignment, it was marked fairly easily for us.

her tests are fairly easy (especially written). The only thing is, she is very rude and unhelpful. Sessional profs are the worst and I recommend everyone to not take this course during the summer semester.
she can't teach

She can't communicate ideas, let alone speak properly (I know the back of her head awefully well). She is always late and never ready for class, and her notes consist of 30 colour pages with only one paragraph of information. Just hope for a good TA.
Dudes a pain in the ass, don't take this class with this guy. Take it with a better prof if you want your gpa saved.

To all the first years( or 2nd) thinking about this course in the fall, I would highly suggest you take it the semester after as this guy singlehandedly makes the course a pain to get through. Not only is there boring useless lectures with only pictures straight from google, he also DOES NOT TEACH!!!!

don't bother with this manssss. at some point buddies gotta get replaced cuz ain't no way bro still teaching with all these bad reviews and being 70 years old..... might as well Enjoy your retirement bud

He's super caring and nice, honestly the best guy ever to become a prof at SFU. All the exams are super easy because they're open book and the class assignments take you almost no time to finish...... SIKE,


Let's just say if you're in this guys class everything I just mentioned will only happen in your dreams!

Class average was a C+ despite me being at roughly a 75-77% in the course. Any other course that would be a B to B+ grade. Class had so many unnecessary assignments that took a lot of time and the midterm although worth only 10% had the most bs questions completely unrelated to course content. Avoid this prof at all costs.
People misunderstand him, if you really pay attention to what he's saying you'll do well. If you have a short attention span, good luck
Bro just simply doesn't teach like he cares but class was light asf
Be prepared for your own doom. This prof gives so many unneccesary assignments and questions on the exam unrelated to the course. I cannot be happier giving this rating at this time.
pay attention during class
Does not care about his students. Midterm and final were absolute torture--hard to study for. Slides don't make sense and there's always the same few pictures and no text.

If you have the option to choose between this lecturer and another, always pick the other. He doesn't include words on his lecture slides, makes you buy his books, which you will never use again for another class, and doesn't like to be questioned about his grading (I got yelled at for pointing out a mistake). Overall, he just needs to retire.

If you have the option to choose between this lecturer and another, always pick the other. He doesn't include words on his lecture slides, makes you buy his books, which you will never use again for another class, and doesn't like to be questioned about his grading (I got yelled at for pointing out a mistake). Overall, he just needs to retire.”……

Pictures instead of words on slides. they have NOTHING to do with Biology.
I never attended a single lecture because it's a waste of your time. 
He lets you use Google during exams. Don't be fooled, that doesn't help you. His questions are when was the author of this book we discussed once in class born. 
The textbook he uses is written by him.

Prof was often unhelpful during office hours, very vague lectures with only pictures as lecture slides, making it impossible to learn. On top of that, you needed a 67% to pass the course with a C- which is insane for a first year class. Half the class failed the first midterm and the class average ended up being a C+, take class with different prof
he is very stubborn with restricted answer key for his exams. exams are way too confusing and challenging

If you take his class, you do not need to buy his textbook just because he says so. Honestly, lectures were impossible to listen to but you still had to because he would sneak spoken info into the exams. The only good thing about this prof is his open book exams and lab instructors to make up for the material he does not teach.

Wasn't nearly as bad as I expected. I wouldn't call him a great prof by any means, like others have said his lectures aren't super useful since the slides are mostly pictures and he goes off topic pretty often, but I still found the material was not too difficult to learn. Midterm was difficult but was curved, and the final was fair in my opinion
Not even over exaggerating when I say avoid at all costs! Didn't even learn anything

do NOT take this class with ron if you have the option of taking it with someone else. anybody would be better than him. his classes are just him rambling on and on with very little useful information actually said. how do you know which information is useful? good question. you dont! horrible professer. im not sure why they havent fired him yet.
It is what it is

Horrible prof and horrible class. I'm not even in this course but I've heard so many bad things. He doesn't teach properly just posts random things that aren't relevant to the actual course and his exams are poorly structured.
I don't get why he is a prof when students are struggling so much. What happened.?

content is not hard, but he overcomplicates so many topics and wastes time by using pictures on his slide with no context. His slides are all over the place, and forgets to add things, and when he goes over something important for once, he skims over it and moves on. I would not recommend this prof if he is teaching, better to wait for someone else
This dude Doesn't teach. I genuinely believe he likes watching people fail his class. Probably gets his jollies off to it.
Horrible Prof should retire this ancient grandpa

4e textbook goes into more depth than he goes into in lectures, Helpful to understand concepts. Personal textbook is copy paste of the lectures and a good study tool. Lectures are confusing but he records them so you can review later. Lectures include unhinged statements. I liked the grading distribution. 40% is participation and easy projects.
He doesn't know how to teach. His lectures only have pictures. I would not recommend taking him as your prof for any bio course!

Doesn't phrase questions in a clear manner and will often try trick questions on tests... lots of them. He says you don't need to know any of the material even though you will. curves grades. overall, it's not the best.

Honestly, the class wasn't bad. The lecture exams only take up 30% of the grade and the rest are determined by lab and projects which saved my grade. If it was only based on exams I would've given this a 1. The lecture exams suck, write down everything and have them ready one one pdf to look up during exams (no google docs allowed). Easy to do well

Don't take classes with him, worst prof ever. He doesn't know how to teach and all his slides are pictures, his exams are ridiculous and so unfair. midterm average was a fail, studying is pointless if you don't have every word he says written down. You can use google on exams but he doesn't agree with googles answers so don't even bother.
This prof does not know how to teach. His slides are only of pictures so they are not helpful. What he teaches in class is nothing on the midterm and final. Very hard class

A professor who rests on his laurels and fits the stereotype of the prof who whips first years into shape lol. I like that he wants students to apply knowledge rather than pure memorization (open book exams), but some questions were poorly written/unnecessary. Make sure you write down EVERYTHING he says! It will be on the exam!

Ron Ydenberg is truly one of the professors of all time. Very calming and soothing voice that could put even the most energetic kid to sleep. His lectures are definitely some of the lectures, so be sure to pay attention to them. Take notes off of the many picture slides he posts. Make sure to listen to what he says, but don't fall asleep doing so.
Doesn't really teach and uses a slide full of pictures and no description.

Absolutely amazing professor, very charming and extremely easy to get a hold of. You will easily be able to understand every single word from him during lecture, and don't worry about notes, you won't need them. As long as you listen during lectures and carefully analyze the pictures on the slides, you will become one of the top students in class.

Ron is extremely knowledgeable, but I found it difficult to extract valuable information from the lectures. His midterm was difficult (I got a 50), but the assignments bumped the class average to a 73. If you have him as a prof I wouldn't say it's the end of the world, but definitely be prepared to put in the work and attend lecture.

make sure you rewatch every lecture he does and write down exactly what he says regardless of how obscure it might sound as it could show up on the midterm. the review lectures are the most important lectures, so make sure you took good and organized notes. overall pretty straightforward class, not a big deal if stuck with him

Must write every word he says & when he says it to make it through the midterm & exam. 40% class average for midterm, given a minute per question due to it being open-book (50 minutes for 50 points). Do not ask him for help with assignments; he will be condescending & dismissive towards you.

CAUTION: Pre-Meds should avoid this professor.

His lectures are unclear, he has the QUIETEST voice. And he uses a microphone but nobody can hear him. He's extremely hard to understand and hear. Could put me to sleep. 
The tests are absolutely completely obscure. Random questions, hyper specific things he says in lecture. 
He seems sweet, but not a very good professor for my style of learning.
Bro he was so @ss. His lectures were all pictures; he didn't explain anything properly. Imma about to do a midterm and I don't what's on it. PLS PLS PLS take any other class thx.

Lectures are horrible, don't make any sense. Nothing connects, he talks the whole lecture & expects you to know everything in lecture for the exams. You literally have to teach urself everything and it's very difficult because he doesn't provide any notes. His slides are just pictures from the textbook. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS IF IT'S NOT REQUIRED.

Tests are based on lectures, and nothing he says connects so it's hard to understand the material if you've never taken bio 11 or other bio courses. You have to end up teaching yourself the material again when you study, and even then it's still hard to understand since his lectures are just slides and textbook diagrams.
I think he should consider becoming a story teller or joining audible.

Lectures were disorganized and consisted of Ron spewing random facts at us for 50 minutes. No matter how much I studied the material, the exam results were always frustrating because the questions are very poorly written, focus on random parts of the concepts, and there is a major time crunch. I do not recommend.

Don't take this class with him. His lectures are random and ridiculous. Midterms are unfair due to time restraints. Open book exams but Google a enemy. Everything he says in lectures is on exams but he talks alot. Only the review lectures were good. Class avg extremely low and blamed us for being dumb. Final was ridiculous. Must put 30 hours a week

Dr. Ydenberg's lectures are seemingly straight out of a documentary. I'm actually going to really miss him as a prof and hope to have him teach me again. He is truly passionate about what he does and loves when you are also passionate about what you're doing in his class. Very literal, very real.

His slides barely have any wordings, just full of pictures and diagrams from the textbook. So in lectures you have to quickly jot everything down. He tests things that are incredibly unreasonable and words the questions so confusingly. Exams are difficult, it is open book but you barely have time to finish, 1 minute per mark. I do not recommend.

I found this course with him pretty easy for my first year. Open book exams, recorded lectures and fairly easy questions. You must pay a lot of attention to his lectures though because that's exactly where he gets his exam questions from. He also marks weirdly. Overall not bad prof
Don't buy the textbook, don't go to lecture, don't study for exams. He has a very soothing and gentle voice, I use his recorded lectures to put myself to sleep every night.

An ok professor. The exams are really hard and I suggest not reading the textbook because he expects understanding of core concepts rather than memorization. The exams are open book but google WILL NOT help you. The questions are usually specific, and expect you to apply concepts straight from the lectures. His review lectures are useless.

Lectures can be interesting if you really listen to what he's saying instead of trying to take notes. Midterms were open book. They're not necessarily difficult, but not enough time is given. You can tell he wants students to succeed. He came in one day wearing all black because he was "mourning" how low the midterm average was lol.

Hes all over the place but isnt that bad. Labs suck they are mostly there so you can do hands on stuff but there is no point for even having a lab for this course. Exams are open book and mostly straight from the notes but he wants his answers in a specific way. Get the 2 projects done with asap (trust me) and out of the way.
He isn't as bad as people say. I can tell that he simply wants his students to do good in this class.

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews on here... yeah sure he doesnt explicitly write down what he is going to test on the lecture slides but he does say it all so as long as you pay attention and listen the exams are fairly easy. He is also extremely organized and has all of our lectures posted at the start of the semester which helped.

He focusses more on the concept rather than memorizing terms., which was great. Weekly lab assignments, and zoom tutorials with participation marks. The exams were ridiculous though. Too many questions with paragraphs long descriptions and long equations for such a short time. Most of us had exam submitted automatically before we were done.

Taken during COVID. Tests (allowed to use Google/notes) are based entirely on specific pre-recorded lectures (that you could watch anytime/at faster speeds). However, his lectures are just pictures from the textbook so reading the textbook to actually learn is a must! Labs are weekly assignments and takes around 2 hrs to do, and camera must be on.

Lazy in "marking" exams. Tells his students he will look over our exam answers but lets the computer mark it with errors in what's really correct and what's really wrong. Difficult to get a hold of. However, I like the sound of his voice, he should really consider narrating a documentary or something.

Ron doesn't believe in memorization but rather the understanding of concepts and the ability to find the specific info you need. I fell asleep every lecture but I took notes on his summarized notes of the textbook and printed some key figures he referred to a lot. With that and my computer which you are allowed to use for tests, I was set.

No notes in his lectures so it took A LOT of time outside of class to self teach from the pictures he gave in his slides. Only gave is 2 hours for our final which was extremely long so ran out of time. Besides that he truly does want us to know the material rather than memorize it, so he was a good prof in that he cared about our learning

I love the way this prof works. Hes not asking you to memorize things like all other biology classes. He simply asks that you understand what's going on and use the correct VOCABULARY for the answers on the exam. These negative reviews are from people that show up to lecture expecting him to just give out answers. I don't go to lectures I have an A
Boring Lecture... monotoned. iclicker sucks.

Open book exam was the hardest exam I've ever done in my life. His lectures contain no notes whatsoever, and is mostly composed of photos from the textbook. He rambles on about things that aren't important and are mostly off topic. Iclicker quizzes weekly on topics that you can't find the answer to from the textbook or lab. Biggest waste of time.

The grading for Ron's tests were VERY subjective and if you had a complaint about how something was graded then he got very defensive and would argue with you. Lectures were very uninformative and worth skipping. Tests only accounted for 40% of our grade thank god because there was an average of about 50% for both the final and the midterm.

Frequently talks about his life, physics, economics, sociology, history, and other things non-biology related. Lecture slides have nothing but blurry and illegible pictures from the textbook. Very monotoned. His exams are difficult and open book. Some questions in the final require you to use other skill than biology skills(e.g English literature)
His lectures are very boring, the way he talks puts you to sleep. No words on the slides, even though it's open book it's still very hard. You need to prepare a lot. Midterm was easy final was rough.

Unclear, boring, and just straight awful. Its pathetic going to class because he doesnt teach you anything he just shows you pictures. All exams are open book (BEWARE) and they dont even begin to cover what is in class. I dont mind working hard for a class if I learnt something but with his class you will work hard and still learn nothing.

Slides are only comprised of graphics/charts - WRITE DOWN EVERYTHING HE SAYS otherwise you won't have any clue whats going on. His explanations were quick and often vague. All exams open book, but don't rely on that to help you pass (very little time to complete questions). Would NOT recommend him as a prof. Avoid at all costs.
Just purely bad. His lectures are about his life story and nothing much more. I cant say much other than the fact that his profession aligns with putting students to sleep.

Bad at giving lectures. He talks about things that aren't even related to what the week's lab is on/what chapter you're currently on in tutorials/labs. He's a nice guy, but his lectures are dry because they are all pictures/paintings and he just natters on about it. No notes in lecture, hard to listen even if you are at the front.

Stay away from this prof!! Seriously I did what everyone on this page said I went to lectures and copied down everything he said as well as listened to the online recordings and in the end he gives me a D. Also his lectures are so boring and useless just avoid him

Even though his lectures can get boring they basically give out the answers for the exams. his recordings are online which really helped me and exams are open book so you should know his lectures very well since he gives the exam based on his lectures, very fair class!

At the beginning of the semester you'll want to kill him because he seems to just be repeating hiself and his notes are only pictures, bue he's real nice and very interested in the subject. His exams are open book and very easy as long as you listen to him in class (or his lecture recordings) and actually understand what he's trying to get across.

I dunno why hes got such bad reviews, exams were VERY fair, and i stress VERY because they were open book, most lectures were interesting not boring, and he seems passionate  about teaching students, also, questions on exams are strictly from lecture

Good prof who knows what he is talking about. Didn't like him at first as his teaching method is different but you still get the same notes. You don't get lecture slides and you have to write EVERYTHING down but his lectures are recorded. If you put in a good amount of work, you will be fine.
HORRIBLE LECTURER! does not follow syllabus at all! avoid him like the plague.

absolutely terrible teacher, has no clue what he is doing... puts up pictures and talks about them. Did not write notes down at all, the whole semester. He is an absolute FAIL of a prof, stay away from his course as much as possible. Trust me, this guy is useless.

His lecture are a bit useless. He just goes over the figures in the textbooks and not anything else. Also during lectures he kinda goes all over the place. For example, one day he just randomly began talking about bulls. NOT the greatest prof. On another note, his application of biogenics is well done however the class was lost.
So far so good for ... he says that nothing will be on the exams that wasnt directly discussed in the lecture, ill take his word on it for now, but i have yet to do any exams
participation does not matter, but recommending to attend labs for sure and tutorials. professor was amazing, very clear, fun, and enjoyable to talk to .
Professor meents is a very understanding and caring prof. Her lecture slides are very informative and clear. The course was  content heavy so there was alot to remember but her exams were fair
Final had bad mcqs (like mostly ‘how many answers are correct' type thing) and short answer questions were more like long answer questions. She's nice and objective list helped.
Her class was quite boring and she had all these extra slides that were not covered in lecture, which just me the course hell. In terms of her marking it was super specific and not super fair.

Professor M is very passionate about bio and really wants you to understand it. I found her lectures kind of boring and the slides not helpful to study off of (Used more as an outline). You definitely have do the readings to have a better understanding. She's very clear on the grading criteria and gives you example exam questions during lectures.

She is an okay prof. I did like her lectures because they were clear but i wasnt a big fan of her slides because they were very vague powerpoints of random pictures. She is a very tough marker, you have to use the exact keywords that she uses or you will lose the mark even if your answer is correct

Ivona is really nice and cares about her student. She tried to make lectures fun and encourages participation. She had weekly quizzes that are super easy if you read the assigned textbook pages. She also assigned some easy project that were nice grade booster. He midterm and final were fairly easy if you watched the lectures.

DO NOT take it with Ivona, unless you want your life to revolve around the course. We have forced pre-reading, two marked quizzes (Pre- and Post-lecture quiz), a 3hr online lab every week. She teaches this course like high school. It bores my mind out to be FORCED to go over the same simple material over and over again for completion marks.

Dr. M is hands down one of the best profs Ive had so far. Weekly quizzes really help you digest the material and you can really tell that they are made to give the student an extra chance to raise their grades. The only thing I didnt like is that the quizzes and the exams were weirdly worded. Overall, a very good professor and class.

Ivona really is such a nice professor. She really wants you to enjoy/ understand the material and is helpful in explaining concepts if you reach out. But this course is so unorganized. The quizzes are not hard but are weirdly formatted, It isn't clear what/how the information will be examined, and the canvas page is chaotic to navigate the info.

Too bad that students could not find useful information from her assignments, lab components, online learning and quizzes. BTW, Pearson online learning is the worst among all online learning platforms.
"Canadian" method of teaching which results in less organized course material, and eventually students receive lower than average grade than other profs.
Not clear grading criteria, not designing a better assignment that would immue to all contigency, very "canadian".

Ivona is a most caring instructor. She is so nice. Must attend her class once if you have a chance. Her exams and quizzes are not hard; coming from her lecture slides and handouts. Do every worksheet because some questions come directly from them. Hard to get full mark but possible to get high mark

She is caring, but her exams are extremely difficult, the wording on the exams is extremely misleading and even if you have the correct answer it will be marked wrong if the words do not directly match up the answer key. Therefore, I suggest you MEMORIZE your lecture slides word for word.

Although prof is a nice person and generally caring about her students, the material covered in class and what will be asked in exams is occasionally very difficult to connect as questions can be asked in a very tricky way.
A really caring prof one of the best I have had so far. Made the course itself much more fun even the you have to work for it to maintain your grade
Great professor.  Cares about students and very passionate.  Have her for lab. Gives clear and easy to follow explanations.  Assignments are straight forward.

really cared about students, especially for a prof midterms were difficult  lab final was very easy as long as you have a good understanding of your lab manual( its open book)  one of the nicest profs i've ever met, but you have to work for your grade

Took BISC101 with Dr.M as well. She is MUCH better for that class since it is more her speciality. The topics in BISC102 are not her specialty and therefore you won't get as good an education as you would if you had a different prof. However, she is very nice to students and will try her best to help you understand the topic. Exams are pretty fair.

OK professor. Not the best that I've ever had, but not the worst. The lecture part wasn't difficult; however, the lab was easy to fail. Her workbook is needed for midterm and the textbook is needed for final. I found the midterm to be fair, final was based on minor details/unimportant concepts.
Final exam covered things that were minor/not even covered in lecture. Seems disinterested in the course herself.

Please try not to take this class with this teacher! I received in the 80's and was given a b-. She doesn't explain why or how she grades this way. My friend received a c+ with 75 percent. She relies heavily on the textbook and covers over 20 chapters. Be prepared to work hard and not get rewarded.

Terrible professor. She purposely speaks extremely fast during lectures, so you have no time to write down the important facts that you heard. Don't ask her questions, she's absolutely unhelpful. The TAs are better She's quite misleading, don't trust her when she says that exams "are based on her lecture notes", you need to read the entire textbook
Horrible prof!

You can try hard and get in the 80's but will still end up with a C+ so there actually is no point to trying in her class unless your getting a 87 or above you can not get a B so good luck if you plan on taking her but i would not recommend it

A very good teacher, I found she made the class very interesting and got the key points across in lectures, be sure to at least skim the textbook because some testable material isnt mentioned in lectures
Skip the lectures.  Stay home and go crazy with post it notes on your textbook, its an open book final.

Midterm average: 23%. Both the midterm and the final were open book (no easy factual recall questions). The ecology project involved actually going out into the woods and counting ferns, whereas other profs simply tell you to pick an article and summarize it. Definitely not the best BISC 102 prof, go with Erin Barley, if you can.

She seemed to have a general interest in the course material, but lectures were useless and lecture notes were not worth reading through. Everything you need is in the textbook, and her exams cover everything so make sure you read the whole book cover to cover.
BEST PROF EVER!! her final exam was soooo easyyy!!! it was all open book...just study the notes and read what she covers in the notes from the textbook and u'll be fine! =)
good lab prof; enthusiastic
she is a great lab instructor - realy answers my questions clearly

Unless you like evolution, avoid the course at all costs. She was alright, kinda boring but tried to present lectures in an interesting way. The TA's were brutal markers for a one hundred level course. Grr. The exams were too bad but the marking was.
i like her cuz shes the only teacher reading and replying to my email over the weekend she answered my questions on saturday midnight.
I find her classes interesting. I like the way she presents things, slides and movies were great. I recommend her.
All I have to say is she got shafted having to teach Bio 102. It's that class you should avoid, not her.
She's the best instructor I've ever had in biology!!!

avoid taking the class with this prof. She doesn?t provide the lecture notes and the class is spent copying down off the Powerpoint and not listening to a thing she is saying. Sample midterm and final were provided but WITH NO ANSWERS??? Her class is not curved so be prepared to have a low class average. The exams are not fair because she doesn?t b

The best bio prof ever! her exams are very straight forward but at the same time challenging, you really gotta study your notes and textbook to be able to ace her exams. I failed the midterm but got 86% on the final, so if i can do it, u can do it! She is extremely helpful if you have questions just go see her and she will try to help you a lot!
This prof said that the grades won't be curved the very first class..she does give out hard exam *WARNING*

I had her for my lab instructor- she was clearly the best teacher in the entire course. This woman seriously knows what she is doing and how to get the message across so students understand. Very easy to talk to and extremely helpful.  Straightforward approach and very knowlegeable person. Her caring for students shines.  Truely inspiring teacher.
She's soooo good, and she recently won an award for being one of the best proffessors in Canada (students were interviewed for there opinions on her teaching and she won because they all loved her!)

I had him for my lab prof and he was so nice, caring and understanding I genuinely had such a great time that I looked forward to his classes. My friend had him as a lecture prof and said similar things about him. Very kind and understanding.

Kevin Lam is just awesome throughout. As a lab instructor for BISC you can really see how he wants students to grasp the knowledge rather than just be ready for tests from memorizing. He always explains to you face to face in labs and tries his best to give you support in a non harsh way. He even gives his cell # for inquiries. Love him
talks too much before labs so I'm hard pressed to finish on time, otherwise he's great, homework is fair

Honestly one of the best profs in the biology department. He was my lab instructor for 102, but has covered lab for my 101 section as well. Great sense of humour haha. Definely recommend taking a course with him!!
awesome prof. probably the best prof i have had at university so far. i understood everything he taught me during lectures. very helpful, and decent looking :)

Course was pretty heavy.. but Kevin did an awesome job teaching it. Some concepts were kind of difficult to understand, but he spent a lot of time in lecture making the topic interesting and easy to understand. As long as you do the pre-readings, quizzes, and attend lecture you should be fine :)

Despite my poor grade he is a great professor. I didn't put enough work into the course as Biology doesn't really interest me. If you like Biology, you're diligent, and you have Kevin as a prof, you will surely succeed. Do all of the weekly questions, including the practice final questions. Also, make sure you go to office hours.

Always willing to go out of his way to answer your questions. This course is content heavy and that's not Kevin's fault. If you do the readings, the homework, and go to class, there's no reason why you should find it difficult. True, there are no answers posted for practice Q's, but that's why you need to go office hours.

Kevin was an amazing prof. Very helpful and clear when explaining topic ... always made lectures interesting. Although he didnt always explain the most difficult topics in lecture and readings each week were very pretty much essential, as long as you prepare for exams using the SLOS he gives you there arent any surprises.

Kevin is an awesome prof. Super dedicated to his students and the materials taught in the class. He is always happy to help and is super friendly during office hours. Kevin makes you want to go to class and makes material easy to remember with his quirky examples. Definitely one of the best profs out there!

Kevin is awesome: explains clearly, makes concepts applicable, and teaches important study skills. Quite a bit of work required for 102, but comparing our class average to other semesters, he's doing a great job. Best of all, Kevin is ALWAYS willing to help... totally goes out of his way to teach well. Take it with Kevin!! And go to office hours!

Kevin's a fantastic prof! He really cares about everyone in his class and wants you to do well. He takes emails anytime and will always meet with you outside of office hours if you want. The flipped classroom is challenging but it works. You will really understand the material if you just put in the work.
Overall always waste time in lecture doing some easy iclicker questions. Never useful. He gives out lots of questions but no answers are provided.

he's super funny and interesting! his lectures are fun and interactive. but I feel his quizzes and the problems he gives are quite hard. sometimes I even feel like I've never learned that. overall great prof, just make the exams easier plz.

Kevin's passion and interest in biology is very apparent and contagious. It is always a pleasure attending his lectures. The course and his new 'flipped classroom" approach is challenging, demanding, but may also be  questionable at points. He is helpful, but continuiously makes mistakes regarding homework postings on canvas and via email.

Awesome prof,  very passionate and genuinely cares about his students. One thing that really stood out and I really really REALLY appreciated was his decision to change his mind and provide audio/video lecture recordings to the class to help out his students this greatly improved my experience of the course. The lab has ridiculous workload btw.

would not recommend loll. he bragged about himself the first day and i though oh well profs never get to talk about themselves its ok but no every single lecture was his life story. slides are literally his vsco photo dump so u can't study off of them for exams. he provides no practice material and tests conceptually, so gl if u ever have him! :((

john is a nice person, definitely nicer than tony for bisc 101 last sem, but a terrible prof. 50 min lecture on ecosystem subsidies and not once did he define what an ecosystem subsidy was, instead told us how hot it was the day him and his team dragged salmon carcasses up a stream. he's passionate but def has an egoistical streak.

Rly passionate in his field which made lecture interesting, he often did go on tangents ab personal stories in lecture but made it clear when u didn't need to memorize info. Even tho final was cumulative it was mostly from after midterm. Give urself at least 2 days to study and u will be good

John is a great guy and frankly I really enjoyed how he did his lectures but, issues arise when it comes to his midterms and finals. They were both very unfair and the marking was unnecessarily difficult for a first year class. As someone who took bisc 101 with Tony Williams I got a better grade with him even though his lecture style was horrible.

Nice guy, but so much was unclear with what he taught compared to what was on the final/midterm. My TA also says some things he teaches should not be included in a 100 lvl course. A literally question on my final was ‘is there such a thing as a species'. Overall unclear grading criteria, expect little to no exam prep, and very open ended questions

Prof is so sweet and the lectures are engaging because you can tell he loves the material. Lecture slides aren't dense so you have more time learning the information rather than just memorizing. The midterm and final are difficult, but he scales!

This class tanked my GPA. I thought i would at least get out of this class with a B- but he made the scaling so weird. you can't get any C+ or B- its just A B or C. honestly I would not recommend this.

A nice guy however as a prof not so great. Very vague with his grading and the concepts that are supposed to be covered. On the midterm the questions were not clear and then on the final it still wasn't. He said we wouldn't have to know specific names of people yet he asked those questions.
Honestly this course shouldn't have been so bad.

John was a very nice and caring prof however, it does not correlate with his marking and course content at all. There was never a clear incentive as to what will appear on the exams. Also you are unable to view your final exam at the end of the course eliminating any possibility of extra marks. I would avoid.
AVIOD AT ALL COST!!!!!! HES SUCH A TOUGH GRADER!!!!
The slides are full of pictures, and he is a tough grader.

as a person, he's sweet. as a professor, i'd rather he retires asap; his lecture slides are a photo album, barely any info is on it. his midterms are a shitshow, w/ very few questions and absolutely no review. hes a tough grader and also conceptual but can't understand not everyone thinks the way he does. makes you rethink why you chose bio 💀

The lectures are really helpful, but the slides to study off don't have much on them. He is really good at making the concepts more understandable. 

The exams test you to see if you really know what you're talking about, so it's not just a memory-based exam. 

He seems very passionate about what he does and wants to help you.

Course content isn't bad it's pretty easy. But the midterm questions weren't structured well. He didn't even give an actual practice midterm. Feels like he only became a prof to boast about his research to be honest.
Seems like a sweet guy but his teaching style and tests aren't good.

The content in this course is very do-able and easy. However, his midterm did not line up with what he told his students ot study. He said to know every one of his research papers for the exam and not a signal one showed up. The average was a 49 and then curved but still extremely low for a biology course. He barley provided practice questions

John was such a fun professor! You can tell he cares a lot about the material which made attending lectures worth it. Hes also super nice and really funny. The class was online but everything was organized really well. Also, the lab worksheets are super helpful and really beneficial when studying for tests!

I loved this class so much. He assigns textbook readings but honestly don't do it, just memorize his lecture slides and understand them and I guarantee you an A on his tests. His tests are very fair, so as long as you don't wing them you're golden. He has lots of interesting guest lecturers and stories, definitely my most enjoyable course this sem.
Don't expect such a horrible experience during her semester. Low efficiency, rush on course material, rough grading of various aspect of labs.
BISC 102 is challenging but also interesting at the same time. Dr. Barley expects students to put forth their best effort. She simplifies complex concepts and is very willing to help you out.

Don't expect that you can acquire any good accomodation from her. You will feel overwhelmed if you take her course with competent workload. Avoid at all cost, self study would be a much better choice.

Erin earns my respect. She as well as the other Instructors have really worked hard in creating interesting labs. By far BISC 102 is the most organized online course that I am taking. I really appreciate the check list of things to do at the beginning and end of the week. Erin challenges you to think, which is vital for a great Instructor.
Refuse to provide any alternatives to any adversity.
one of the worst prof i had experinced, not caring students.
worst prof ever! no help for any component of study
Not clear grading criteria, using some limited space to grade, grade by sometimes "idiotic" things, not balanced; unsupportive manner, very rude, discrimatory grading.
Not too much helpful guide. Not providing any meaningful feedback. If you tried to seek help from the prof, you might get even more confused.

Erin is by far my best prof at SFU. I had her for both lecture and lab. Lectures were very interesting and usually would have some examples or fill in the blanks with her notes. Explains everything in such great detail and helped me understand the course material a lot better! Looks for specific answers in exams. Is a very sweet and caring prof!

Erin is a pretty solid professor for both lab and lecture. She might seem a bit intimidating at first glance but she really isnt! Shes very nice and willing to answer any of your questions. Highly recommend.
Erin is a great prof. She is always willing to answer any questions students may have and her exams are fair.

First midterm the average was 65%. It was pretty straight forward and if you do the readings and understand the concepts correctly, then its not a hard test. I personally got a 73% and i'm not a very smart student.
Erin is a nice professor. Her constant use of i-clickers was a bit annoying.

She's a good professor and her exams are mostly memorization & applying concepts which is expected. You need to pass the lab exam to pass the course so make sure to study for that. I also think she and the people who mark the lab exams want specific answers so put as much detail as possible and study in advance!

Very articulate and knowledgeable prof who goes out of her way to make ecology and evolution interesting to everyone. I loved this class and found every aspect of it very fair. I unintentionally didn't use the text book at all for this course; I found attending her lectures and labs were enough to understand the concepts.
Erin is a great prof + lab instructor. Her exams are fairly easy, and she is helpful and always willing to answer any questions you have.

Really enjoyed her. She speaks slowly but clearly. You'd really be surprised as to how much content she gets in for each of her lectures. Went to her offices hours twice- and both times were worth it. So satisfied with this class. Final was fair and actually easy, but you have to prep- midterm had a couple tricky MC questions (but don't they all).

Erin was a okay professor. The materials were pretty tough but she taught them easily. There are lecture recordings always so you can listen them anytime. The tests are fair but you should read lecture notes very precisely. She is always there for help. Visit her office hour and I definitely want to recommend to take her course.

she is quiet picky, but as long as you follow what she asked you, then you should be fine. A really helpful instructor, she gave you instruction clearly. But you need to put great effort in the lab. I will say she is a good instruction. Remember to practice the questions on the lab manual as the exam questions can be found on the lab manual.

Erin is very picky in how she wants you to answer questions so you should attend every lab and ask as many questions possible! The labs were boring for me and you need to put in good effort to get a good grade in this class

Very approachable for further discussions and questions in lab. I have never had her as a professor so I cannot say much, I only had her as my lab instructor. She is very clear at the beginning of each lab of what the outline of our labs will be like. However, she is very particular on grammar and sentence structure!

Pretty helpful if you ask her questions in lab, but she does have an attitude towards students. Lab final wasn't too bad, just make sure you ask the TAs lots of questions to write in your notebook, and you must make sure you've gone thru everything as several topics are covered.
easy, interesting class. Ask her lots of questions during labs and the answers she gives usually end up on the tests
Very helpful, lectures were boring but she's a fair prof.
Her exams are hard, her lectures are extremely boring. If you are lucky enought to get a fair marker, you are set, otherwise, you will experience diffiulty, as the TA's marking can be unfair
WORST PROF EVER! She has favorite students and hates some. Do not take the class with her you will regret it
Hint  You dont even need to buy a textbook for this class
Good at her job. She knows what shes doing and shes good at explaining it.

The lectures were clear and what was asked on slides was what showed up on exams. She likes to stress what will show up on the exam so you have a pretty good idea going in.  Her slides were better than the textbook (never even had to look through it and finished with an A-)
I found her really boring, its was really hard to sit through her class and be awake, shes a nice lady though.  Then again, i hate evolutionary biology.

first of all, either print out her notes before each lecture or type it out on a laptop. its impossible to get it down by hand. she is an informative teacher in the sense that you do not feel like you need to read the lecture notes in order to understand the basic concepts. MIDTERM was somehwat difficult but no surprises. good job erin

Midterm has multiple choice and short answer portions, and nothing unexpected appeared on it. The lab final for this course is tough, regardless of who you take the course with. Memorize the notes and you'll be fine on the lecture portion of the course. The lab... well, lets not talk about the lab.

I would really recommend her as a prof. She doesn't just teach the material, which is basically all her job requires. She goes above and beyond by including examples and interesting facts to try to help explain the material in a more comprehensive manner. Her exams are very fair, and you can tell she really cares about her students' opinions.
excellent prof. i was in her bio 102, and learned a lot from her!
hard marker!!! gets flustered too easily too.
HARD grader and she can't answer your questions without you getting even more confused.  She's just no good.

great lab instructor. welcomes all questions. but a very hard marker for the overview article... even if you got a good grade for the little assignments prior to this, don't think you'll do as well on the overview. there's no grading scheme; she just picks a random mark (u can't even argue with it).. otherwise she's a good prof
No Comments

Her lab final is brutal and open-booked. Marks very hard and wants the answers to be very clear and specific and detailed. Unless you have to take this course or like evolution, avoid BISC 102 at all cost
brutal lab final =(

Erin was knowledgeable, approachable, and always well prepared. The labs weren't terribly exciting, but the lab exam was fair and as a plus, I won a fish :). Erin's great - I recommend taking any course with her.

Erin is SO intelligent and knowledgeable about the subject matter. The final lab exam was difficult, but it was open-book, so if all the labs are done thoroughly and the questions are answered, you'll do fine. Overall, she was very kind!!
She is the Lab instructor.....she seems to be a good instructor when she is in lab...good at explaining stuff....but the lab final is a heart attack.
don't take this class with this prof he is quite literally the worst ever. so boring his exam questions are so specific and just stupid
Interesting content. Exams are very reasonable!

Boring lectures and challenging exams. The only thing I can think about him being a good professor is that his slides are somehow helpful. Other than that, other experiences from his class are bad. Good luck if you have him as the prof for this 4 credit course
Super uncaring monotone prof with useless lectures. C+ average and the dude told TAs to not answer questions during exams :D

Probably the worst prof I've ever had, the average for the class was a C, most people failed the first midterm. Talks about stuff not relevant to the course. Midterm and final are the only things that counted, I went to his office hours for help and he told me it was a waste of time to ask for help and that I should just drop the course. AVOID!!

Professor Rolf Mathewes isn't the worst. However, you may find his lectures monotonous because he isn't very engaging. The lecture material is straight from the slides without any additional info. Attendance was basically optional. The course is heavy in memorization. Ensure you understand the basics of every lecture and the grade is an easy A.

paid $800 for him to read directly off of slides from 2006 and for the exams to have a 50 average with no scaling. will not clarify on anything during exams and prevents tas from answering questions on ANYTHING during the exam

Dr. Mathewes' monotonous voice and BISC 102 generally being boring made this course difficult to succeed in. Whenever I attended lectures, I found it difficult to stay focused, as he does not engage the students in the course material. His exams are difficult, ESPECIALLY the matching section. Perhaps this class may be easier if students enjoy BISC.
Told all the TAs not to help students and yelled during an examination for no reason. Exam topics and questions not made clear to the class. World's biggest flop and oldest living fossil

focuses more on the history and names of people who discovered certain fossils rather than the main content. Try's to trick you with exam questions and when you ask a TA for clarification he states "That students are asking too many questions and that we should only talk to the TA's if there's an error on the exam" as if that's how exams work.

I really liked Rolf. I felt his lectures were clear and informative. Lecture slides complemented with reading the textbook was enough to do well on the exams. The exams are fair, although the final definitely felt rushed. Second half of course has a lot more material compared to the first half. I recommend this professor.

not the best or worst. lectures are useless, just read his lecture slides and textbook on areas needing clarification. midterm was pretty straight forward, although the ta's are unnecessarily picky when marking labs and exams. take class w/ this prof if you need to, but you don't need to actively avoid taking it w/ him.

each lecture slide is like a whole separate topic and not connect at all, you can prob watch the whole lecture and feel like its pointless, just read the textbook and pray that exams are ez if you get him

exams are on super specific lecture examples and lectures are boring and useless but you cant skip if you wanna do well. the whole course is basically self taught since you need to read all the textbook in order to understand any of the topics and the lecture is also needed for the overly specific examples. take it with diff prof if you can

I don't know why there are so many negative reviews. I had him during summer semester and he is a really solid choice for bisc 102. Exam material was fair, TAs were okay. He seems like a nice person and his research is very interesting. I would recommend him for any class.

He doesn't care about the students and has the hardest midterms/exams during remote learning. He isn't a good teacher cuz he just goes over his lecs quick and barely takes into consideration of the way he puts up exams. His TAs were the most incapable team that I ever encountered simply because they literally had no knowledge on the course material
Just like a robot, not answering students' requests. Still propagating some ideologies related to backward abrahamic cults.
Not caring students, decline to reply any students' requests or questions (!)
GRADE BY FEW THINGS AND TEST WAS NOT DEDICATED IN LINE WITH OTHER SCHOOLS.

Prof is a forensic biologist, which is pretty cool, but other than that, you don't need to show up for his lectures. He reads everything off his slides and posts them after class. If you do show up, make sure to bring coffee. Tests are fairly standard, as long as you read textbook and look over slides. Average prof.

Smokin' hot prof with his coffees every lecture, yet ironically, speaks with a monotone voice as well. Other than that, he's the norm. Lecture slides can be a bit disorganized and he does not post the notes before class. Make sure you sleep well before class, otherwise his monotone voice may put you to sleep. Js dudes, it happened to me. :(

Only complain are lecture slides. Material is fairly interesting if you like biology. The lecture slides are all over the place. It is hard to know what you are expected to know. Attending lecture is pointless since he reads the powerpoints word  for word, and audio and video recordings of lectures are uploaded.

Lectures were boring, but you can tell he is interested in what he is teaching. Notes did contain useful information for the most part, but reading the textbook is key. Did throw in a lot of non-exam material, which was interesting. Pay attention to examples.

He gave a lot of examples in lecture directly out of textbook. You didn't really need to attend lecture as long as you read the textbook material and look over his ppt slides. He was passionate about the subject and answered questions fine. I didn't like a bird assignment we had to complete...

You can tell he's really into bio and always gives helpful examples of how what we're learning is applied to the real word. The course itself is kind of scattered which is why people probably think the lectures are scattered .. but honestly I found the material really interesting.
No need to show up to lectures (pointless and will bore you to death), but be sure to look at the lecture notes because some of the examples used are on the exams.

Lecture is useless. He'll talk about extra stuff mostly, that you don't even need to know. Sometimes put stuff on exams that we weren't even assigned to read. Overall, could've done better in course if I had a better prof.
Very clear and funny at times. Exams are more on lecs than text but still know both very well
I found him to be a very good prof.  Presents very good lecture notes and he is very clear in his expectations for exams.  Made the material interesting.
his notes are pretty bad, the course itself is boring, just memorize everything and you'll be fine
Good prof. Good for a first year course. I liked that he brought a quick discussion of how Christiany and Biology are not mutually exclusive... recommended
Found his marking scheme very bizarre.  Very good lecturer - makes things understandable.
this course is terrible and this guy is pretty bad too, doesn't give you an idea of what type of questions he puts on his exams, don't take this course if you don't have to
Great person, good lectures
Could actually explain concepts and knew what he was talking about
Very good lecturer.

Nice prof, very hard class. Bisc 406. Interesting course but extra test heavy. Doesnt seem to test knowledge sometimes, more based on skills to type/ computers. Prof is great but course needs to differ.
Not a nice prof. Takes herself far too seriously. Respect her or else.

Dr. Cote is an awesome lecturer and you can see very clearly her passion for biology. She cares about her students and if notices a common misconception or confusion, she will go back and clearly explain the material again. She's usually very easy to listen to. Come to lectures because her lectures are usually completely different from the readings
Great lecturer. Her lecture notes are very detailed. The material in the course is not too hard but she is a VERY tough grader.

Dr. Cote is a great prof, incredibly passionate about what she does and her lectures are quite interesting, even though I have no interest in biology. One lecture is entirely Harry Potter references, which was awesome. Tests are really hard though, study the slides very closely and know the test cases she uses. Don't underestimate the Eco-Evo.

Dr. Cote is one of my favourite profs I've had so far.  Not only is she extremely passionate about what she teaches, but she's also an amazing lecturer.  She's very clear; I never left lecture without understanding what she was talking about.  I would highly recommend taking a class with her!
Really passionate about what she does, and is very clear too! Great proff, exams are pretty tough though.

The class itself isn't easy, there's a lot of content covered in not a lot of time. Dr. Cote is great though, so passionate about what she does and is so helpful. Definitely utilize office hours! Great examples, plus she makes Harry Potter references :)

Dr Cote was definitely a passionate and great professor. Make sure to read the textbook! For some reason the midterm was pretty hard and the average was 36% which later caused remarking so it can be boosted to 46%. Make sure you know the general big concepts and you should be fine!

Dr. Cote was such an absolutely wonderful welcome to the Biology program at SFU. Clearly VERY passionate about what she does, and this is reflected in her engaging, well thought out lectures. Her exams are challenging, but great in the sense that they push you to think conceptually and to APPLY what you're taught.

She was okay, most of the stuff are from the textbook. Make sure u read and memories things from the textbook as well. Midterm was hard but the final was fair. Lots critical thinking questions on the exams. Read textbook before lecture helps
Isabelle is one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Make sure you read the textbook (to help understand better when you attend lecture) but the midterm/final is really all on lectures (so attend!!)
Best prof I had in my entire degree.

She's an amazing prof and you can tell she cares about what she's teaching. Exams were a bit hard though, and you can't just memorize everything like in bisc 101, you need to be able to apply your knowledge. Don't bother with the textbook, focus on her slides and what she says in class. If you can, try to bring up your mark in the lab

One of the best profs I've ever had, she makes the topics very interesting. Know her lecture notes, and try to recognize the style of questions she uses as examples (she likes to use odd/fun questions). Exams were not easy - study the notes very well, and manage your time on the tests wisely!
Midterms/final were okay, not too hard. Just need to read the powerpoints and you should be good. She's a friendly prof and tries to make the stuff interesting.

She is an excellent professor.The exams are very fair but they are challenging.Best strategy would be mastering her lecture notes and listening to lecture recording.You don't need to read the text because nothing from it shows up.Her notes are great and make sure that you know all the examples and case studies that she talks about in lectures.
Great prof!! Makes everything really clear, she's passionate about what she teaches and it shows.  Exams are hard but fair. Highly recommend taking one of her classes

Great prof! Her lecture notes are simple and easy to understand, and she is very good at clarifying things. Very interesting course! Tests are fair, study your notes and you'll be fine. Also, in tests, try to think "beyond the question" when answering, if that makes any sense. She loves a good explanation!

Dr. Cote is an interesting and fairly nice prof. Her midterm is fair, but the final was pretty brutal to me.  It will basically drag out everything that u've learned through out the course.  However, her lecture slides are good, even better when combined with the book. The course is prob harder for most since it takes a whole lot of understanding.

Isabelle Cote is amazing! This lady is super funny and makes the class that much better! (Avoid Joan Sharp) Dr.Cote is fair on the midterm however the final is basically you applying the knowledge that you've gained throughtout the semester. Which isnt as bad as it sounds! She's a super loving teacher and you're guaranteed for great laugh!

Tests are brutal. Questions are extremely vague, and you must use very specific words to receive any marks. You cannot just explain thoroughly. Tests consist of statements not covered in class that require "applying knowledge." You are NOT told what kind of info to include in answers, so basically write everything you can think of for each answer.

Dr Cote is really nice and wants everyone to do well. She is clear in her explanations and does not overload students with too much detail. She is very passionate about the subject and makes the class somewhat interesting. She also make some jokes and funny comments. if you have a chance, take the class when she's teaching it.

Though Dr. Cote was a very fun and interesting prof that made BISC 102 tolerable, her exams were kind of bizarre (eg. writing a personal ad pretending your a woman!). Her lectures we fun, she cracked jokes, but be sure to write notes on your printed powerpoint slides since she mentions important details that aren't on the slides.
Dr Cote was extremely helpful and was obviously passionate about what she was teaching. She made the material manageable and understandable.
No Comments

Leah is everywhere during her lectures and often times discusses overly complicated topics that don't help teach the important concepts of the course. Eventually I stopped going to lectures, and spent more time teaching myself the important concepts on my own time.

This was my first year at SFU so hard to be specific but she was really nice and I really liked her. One of the TAs was really mean to her so not sure what that was all about. The text book was terrible but I think she did her best to help us make it useful for the course.

This is my first year and I think she is an awesome prof. Really interested in what she is teaching and concerned for us. The text book sucked and the ta's didn't really support her. It was kindof awkward.

Mumbles, talks super fast and doesn't really know how to use the mic properly. HOWEVER, she is one of the easiest profs I've ever had. Questions on the midterms and final come straight from the weekly quizzes (done in tutorial) which you will have answers to and lab final is open book. VERY easy A, skipped more than half the lectures.

Her first year in teaching a course, so she tends to be a bit scattered. Doesn't always follow her lecture notes and I can hardly hear her. However her exams are EASY. They're taken straight off the weekly quizzes. LOTS of material to memorize. Always, always ask the TAs for help and clarification. However she is kind.

Lectures were all over the place. First time teaching the course and evident. Weekly reading quizzes in tutorial that showed up on the midterm and final exam. Overall easy marker. Not approachable for this class- rely on TA's!

Super easy course but she has some microphone phobia or something. Refuses to wear the mic properly so you can't hear her. On top of that she talks extremely fast and mumbles and goes off on tangents. Hard to follow, quiz answers sometimes dont make sense. Recommend for an easy A, but lectures are useless and don't buy the text book I never used it
